comments: a(n) = number of runs in polyphase sort using 8 tapes and n-6 phases.
references: N. Wirth, Algorithmen und Datenstrukturen, 1975, (table 2.15 chapter 2.3.4)
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
R. L. Gilstad, Polyphase Merge Sort - Advanced Technique, Proc. AFIPS Eastern Jt. Comp. Conf. 18 (1960) 143-148.
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,1,1,1,1,1,1).
example: General formula for k-th order numbers: f(n,k)=f(n-1,k)+...+f(n-1-k,k) for n > k, else f(n,k) = 1
maple: A060455 := proc(n) option remember: if n >=0 and n<=6 then RETURN(1) fi: a(n-1)+a(n-2)+a(n-3)+a(n-4)+a(n-5)+a(n-6)+a(n-7) end;
crossrefs: Cf. A253333, A253318: primes and indices of primes in this sequence.
Cf. A122189 Heptanacci numbers with a(0),...,a(6) = 0,0,0,0,0,0,1.
author: _Frank Ellermann_, Apr 08 2001
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Apr 11 2001
